meanings.definition: Unfair bias towards a particular person or group.
meanings.sent1: Her partiality towards her best friend was evident to everyone.
meanings.sent2: The judge's partiality towards the defendant raised concerns about the fairness of the trial.
meanings.sent3: His partiality for always choosing the same team in games made his friends tease him.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's partiality towards certain students was like a spotlight on their achievements.
meanings.sent5: The company's hiring process was marred by partiality, leading to dissatisfaction among applicants.

meanings.definition: A liking or preference for something.
meanings.sent1: Her partiality for chocolate ice cream was well-known among her friends.
meanings.sent2: His partiality for action movies made him a regular at the cinema.
meanings.sent3: The cat showed partiality for the sunny spot by the window.
meanings.sent4: The chef's partiality for using fresh ingredients elevated the quality of his dishes.
meanings.sent5: The child's partiality for playing with building blocks sparked creativity and imagination.

meanings.sent1: The partiality report only covered the first quarter of the year.
meanings.sent2: Her partiality knowledge of the subject made it challenging for her to complete the assignment.
meanings.sent3: The partiality map failed to show all the important landmarks in the city.
meanings.sent4: The partiality information provided in the article left readers with more questions than answers.
meanings.sent5: The partiality view from the top of the hill was still breathtaking.
